DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text to represent the best overall disease response recorded from the start of the study treatment until the end of treatment taking into account any requirements for confirmation.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Having the most positive qualities._Including everything._A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part._Response; a bodily process occurring due to the effect of some foregoing stimulus or agent.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Having the most positive qualities.:Including everything.:A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.

Concepts.definition: Having the most positive qualities.
Including everything.
A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.

Property.preferredDefinition: Response is any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent.

Concepts.definition: Any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: RECIST:Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Standard parameters to be used when documenting response of solid tumors to treatment; a set of published rules that define when cancer patients improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stable"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments. (from www.recist.com)._Having the most positive qualities._Including everything._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

Concepts.definition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

Concepts.definition: Unable to be evaluated.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding indicating that there is a decrease in the size and the extent of tissue involvement by a malignant tumor in a patient.

DataElement.changeDescription: 8/31/17 tt CDE versioned for change to VD and short name; transferred Context, changed reg status and released per Round 5 finalization task. 5/28/16 jk moved from EDRN to MCL context CSI.  12/12/14 jc added Exceptional Responder CSI. 6/3/14 added Non-CR/Non-PD value per CCR Round 5 community review comment; upd max length and released CDE/DEC/VD for DCP reuse. jc  11/20/13 changed origin to RECISTv1.1. jc  8/22/13 created for RECIST CRF module based on section 4.4.3 and Table 3 of RECISTv1.1 Guidelines.  jc
